servicenow.read.inkling.com

Module 4.3 Service Catalog and Request Management
Page: Record Producers

Answer is C
Default variable editor is available only for record producer

C - in the book 'ITSM implementation VANCOUVER' 
PAGE 135 at the bottom
Note: 'DEFAULT VARIABLES EDITOR' is only for record producers.
Def C - the wording is a bit weird in this question, but what they mean i to add another field or variable to the Record Producer form - so C is definitely the answer.
A. No such thing as "Record Producer Form Designer" however Form Designer can be used for any table with a form including Record Producers
replies: Form design would do the trick for this question

comments.content: Maybe I am blind but I can't see Form Designer :?

The default variable editor is applicable only for record producers. This editor is a formatter added on records that are generated by a record producer for task-extended tables. This editor displays the values of questions specified in the record producer.
replies: Page 133. The Default Variable Editor is just for displaying value of questions for records generated from a RP. Question asks about adding a field

comments.content:
B. Record Producer Form Designer.

In ServiceNow, to add a field to a record producer form, you would typically use the Record Producer Form Designer. This formatter allows you to add fields, sections, and other form elements to a record producer form, and configure their properties and behavior.
Following logic it should be B

adding a field to a record producer form can be done through the form designer or form builder
Answer B
C is incorrect that is to configure the default variables B is correct

Default Variables Editor is used to modify the default values for variables used in record producers WHILE Record producer form designer allows you to modify the fields and layout of the form used for creating new records in ServiceNow. You can add, remove, or modify form fields, configure the layout of the form, and configure form-related settings, such as the form's name and description.

Default variable editor
The default variable editor is applicable only for record producers. This editor is a formatter added on records that are generated by a record producer for task-extended tables. This editor displays the values of questions specified in the record producer.

https://docs.servicenow.com/ja-JP/bundle/utah-servicenow-platform/page/product/service-catalog-management/concept/service-catalog-variable-editor.html

questions.question: Which role has the ability to configure and manage Incident Management properties?

comments.content:
servicenow.read.inkling.com
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation On Demand
Module 5.1 Incident Management
Page: Incident Management Platform Roles

Answer is D

URL: https://servicenow.read.inkling.com/
Book: "IT Service Management Fundamentals"
Section: "Roles in Incident Management"

"incident_manager: Can administer incident properties and major incident trigger rules."
From Vancouver book page 236 Incident _manager or admin
D page 255
Definitely D - pg 255 in Tokyo book

C. itil_admin

In ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) terminology, the role that has the ability to configure and manage Incident Management properties is typically the "itil_admin." This role is responsible for overseeing the implementation and customization of ITIL processes within an organization, including Incident Management. They have administrative privileges that allow them to configure, maintain, and manage various aspects of the Incident Management process, such as defining incident categories, escalation procedures, and other properties related to handling incidents effectively.

questions.question: What is normally done when a Root Cause and a Workaround are identified for a problem to document the quickest known resolution?

comments.content:
A Publish Workaround

For Documenting Knowen error is also another way but it will take some time to approve before publishing.

The question is about the quickest way.
Its A you would do A first before you do B
The related link is named "Communicate Workaround, not "Publish Workaround". The Answer is B

When a root cause and a workaround are identified for a problem, the next step is typically to document a Known Error in the system. A Known Error includes the Root Cause of the issue and the Workaround, providing a quick reference for resolving the issue if it occurs again.

The answer is A. Discussion is over.

This question is about using Comunicate Workaround relatad link to notice all related Incident requester after inputing workaround and cause note of Analisys information in Probrem Record. Document a Known error is to slow compared to this way.
https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-service-management/page/product/problem-management/task/communicate-workaround.html

I've checked the official ServiceNow documentation, and it confirms that the correct answer is B. Document a Known Error. This process involves creating a Known Error article from a problem, which documents both the root cause and the workaround. This ensures that the quickest known resolution is recorded and can be referenced for future incidents.

The answer is A (then you would do B). Confirmed by two CMAs. "We publish a KB as a workaround for the known issue. Then, we publish the root cause, and known issue with the fix pointing to a future release and the stopgap as the work around."

FYI - The UI action is "Communicate Workaround".

So "Publish Workaround" does not exist. Also, the "Known Error Article" contains the "Workaround"...

servicenow.read.inkling.com
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation On Demand
Module 6.3 Problem Management
Page: Create Known Error Article

Answer is B

Always follow best practice and dont let the word, "quickest" throw you off.

Is there a publish workaround option? Communicating the workaround does not sound like "documenting" the workaround. I think that quick here refers to a quick temporary fix that does not need to wait for a change.
B
A based on the Vancouver edition
I don't see where Communicate Workaround requires a known Root Cause. I think this one is B.
Def B - it's not asking for the quickest way to documet, it;s the quickest knowwn resolution, so that would be to documeent a known error.
A - The "quickest" is Publish Workaround
A is correct.
Publish workaround is the quickest
Correct
replies: think also A is correct. B does work but is not the quickest way.

questions.question:
A problem investigation had been previously closed, because the risk was accepted, in favor of using the workaround, instead of applying the fix. After a couple of weeks, the issue starts to occur more frequently, so management wants to re-visit the root cause analysis.

What would be the next step for this problem?
answers: A. If 7 days has passed, since the Problem was closed, it cannot be re-opened
B. Problem Manager clicks Re-Analyze on the Problem record
C. Problem Assignee clicks Re-Open on the Problem record
D. Administrator clicks Re-Open on the Problem Record

comments.content: When a problem is Closed, it typically cannot be reopened after a certain period (e.g., 7 or 14 days, depending on system configurations). If management wants to revisit the root cause analysis after some time, they should use the Re-Analyze action, which allows re-examining the problem without violating ITIL best practices. The Problem Manager is the appropriate role to perform this action, as they oversee problem investigations and ensure they align with business needs.

"You can reanalyze the problem even after it is closed by clicking Re-analyze. The state of the problem changes from Closed to Root Cause Analysis."
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-service-management/page/product/problem-management/task/resolve-and-complete-problem.html

p351
check diagram 
we can reopen a closed problem and the problem manager can do this activity.
A can be also correct ?
replies: No, A isnÂ´t right. That is a property of the incident mgmt.

comments.content: correct

questions.question: What is an example of a Key Performance Indicator for Change management that is included with Performance Analytics, but not available in ServiceNow reporting? (Choose two.)
answers: B. Count of Completed Changes per Month, by Change Type
D. Count of Completed Changes per Month, by Category

comments.content:
From the book:
Key Performance Indicators for Performance Analytics:
- % unauthorized changes
- % changes with incorrectly assessed risk or impact
- Number of change request not updated in x days
- Average age change request on problems
- Number of changes without approved change request
- Time taken from approval to scheduling
- % successful changes

The correct answers are A. % Successful Changes and C. % Unauthorized Changes.
These Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) are included with Performance Analytics but are not available in ServiceNow reporting.

questions.question: Your customer wants to add a notification to the Change - Emergency - Authorize Flow. What is the first thing you would do to meet this requirement?
answers: A. Create a copy of the baseline Change - Emergency - Authorize Flow, and then edit the new copy
B. Create a backup of the baseline Change - Emergency - Authorize Flow, and edit the baseline flow
C. Deactivate the baseline Change - Emergency - Authorize Flow
D. Unpublish the baseline Change - Emergency - Authorize Flow

comments.content:
The correct answer is A. Create a copy of the baseline Change - Emergency - Authorize Flow, and then edit the new copy.
Creating a copy of the baseline flow allows you to make the necessary changes without affecting the original baseline flow. This approach ensures that you can always refer back to the original flow if needed and helps maintain the integrity of the baseline configuration.
ITSM Implementation Tokyo eBook pg 444
Copy the existing one and edit the newly created flow
correct

Change Management in ServiceNow ensures that all changes, including the addition of new catalog items, are properly evaluated, authorized, and implemented with minimal risk.

Service catalog management relies heavily upon:
- the change management process for controlling changes to the service catalog

questions.question: When configuring stages in Flow Designer, what are some of the options that can be done? (Choose two.)

When configuring stages in Flow Designer, you can: â¢ Create any number of stages. â¢ Change stage labels and names. â¢ Set the estimated duration for a stage. â¢ Import a copy of a pre-defined stage set from the Stage Sets table. Any changes made to the copy do not affect the original stage set record. ITSM Implementation book Page ( 176 )

A. Stage labels and names can be changed
D. Estimated durations can be set

When configuring stages in Flow Designer, you can change the name or label of the stages, and also set the estimated duration for each stage. This helps in tracking how much time is taken for each stage in the flow. However, Flow Designer is not directly related to the Requested Item states or SLAs.

questions.question: How are Service Catalogs and Catalog Items related? (Choose two.)
answers: A. A catalog item can be associated with one or more service catalogs
B. Access to catalog items is determined by the service catalog's assigned user criteria
C. Service catalogs may contain multiple catalog items
D. A catalog item can only be associated with one service catalog

comments.content: These two points highlight the flexible relationship between service catalogs and catalog items. A catalog item can indeed be linked to multiple service catalogs, and each service catalog can contain various catalog items, providing a structured way to manage and offer services.

Yes
correct
Correct

questions.question: What would you use to define a common grouping of configuration items such as all web servers in Miami?

comments.content:
The correct answer is D. Dynamic CI group.
A Dynamic CI group allows you to define a common grouping of configuration items based on specific criteria, such as all web servers in Miami. This group can automatically include CIs that meet the defined criteria, making it easier to manage and track related CIs.

Correct Answer is D 
A Dynamic CI group is a dynamic grouping of configuration items (CIs), based on some common criteria. For example, you can create a dynamic CI group based on the location of all web servers in Detroit or all Oracle databases in Boston.

p39
D is correct
correct

questions.question: After publishing an Item via Catalog Builder, the associated update set is set to which state?

comments.content:
After publishing an item via Catalog Builder in ServiceNow, the associated update set is set to B. Complete.
This indicates that the updates have been finalized and applied to the Service Catalog.
Tricky question! The UPDATE SET is Complete when a Catalog Item is Published. See Page 139.
Complete

In Washington the State = Complete.
There are only three options, "In Progress", "Complete", and "Ignore"
The update set is set to complete state, Vancouver page 139

The State for the catalog item will be PUBLISHED , and the state of the Update Set will change to complete .
When the state for catalog item was Publishing the state for update set was In progress. Verified in PDI , correct answer is B = Complete
B - This question asks update set state
The associated update set will be in 'Complete' state once the item is published. There is no 'Published' state for an update set.

This question asks update set state.
answer is B.

Answer D
Catalog Builder item states are:
Draft -> Publishing -> Published

questions.question: Which of these can be associated with a service within the service portfolio taxonomy?

comments.content:
The correct answer is D. Leaf node.
In the context of a service portfolio taxonomy, a leaf node represents the most granular level in the hierarchy where individual services are categorized. This allows for detailed and precise organization and management of services within the portfolio.
Answer is D

In ServiceNow's service portfolio taxonomy, the term "Leaf node" is typically associated with a service within the taxonomy. So, the correct option would be:
D. Leaf node

questions.question: Which is the process responsible for delivering items that have been ordered from a Service Catalog?

comments.content:
The Request Management Lifecycle:
1. Submission
2. Approval
3. Fulfilment
4. Closure


Answer is C

I believe it is E = Request Management
As per the ITSM Implementation book - after placing an order the request management process begins.

servicenow documentation for Service Catalog request fulfillment:
When a user orders a catalog item, a request is created that follows a fulfillment process. A fulfillment process defines the steps to request approval, assign fulfillment tasks, and fulfill requests. Flow Designer flows, workflows, or execution plans are used to define fulfillment processes.
The correct name is Service Catalog Request Fulfillment. So I think C is the closest.

questions.question: Where is the definition of what is provided, or not provided, for a service defined?

comments.content: The service scope defines what is provided or not provided for a service. It sets clear boundaries and details about the service's capabilities, inclusions, exclusions, and limitations.

questions.question: What defines the required approvals and the associated conditions for a change model?
answers: B. A change model's state transitions
C. A change model approval definition
D. A change approval lifecycle flow

comments.content:
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation - Vancouver - page 427

Change approval policy is the correct answer.

A change approval policy defines the required approvals and the associated conditions for a change model. It specifies the criteria and conditions under which different types of changes are evaluated and approved.

questions.question: Which organizational role is responsible for the overall administrative capabilities of a portfolio?

comments.content: The Portfolio Manager oversees the strategic and administrative aspects of portfolio management, ensuring alignment with organizational goals, managing resources, and overseeing the delivery of value through the services and projects within the portfolio.
Answer is B
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation - Vancouver page-79
